children.name: .area()
filter
children.info: Filters the data according to the specified accessor or values. It does not affect inferred scale domains

children.name: sort
children.info: Sorts the data according to the specified comparator, accessor, or values. If the sort option is a function but does not take exactly one argument, it is assumed to be a comparator function. Otherwise, the sort option is interpreted as a channel value definition and thus may be either as a column name, accessor function, or array of values

children.name: reverse
children.info: Reverses the sorted (or if not sorted, the input) data order

children.name: x1
children.info: The horizontal position of the baseline bound to the x scale

children.name: x2
children.info: The horizontal position of the topline bound to the x scale. If x2 is not specified, it defaults to x1

children.name: y1
children.info: The vertical position of the baseline bound to the y scale

children.name: y2
children.info: The vertical position of the topline bound to the y scale. If y2 is not specified, it defaults to y1

children.name: z
children.info: A categorical value to group data into series. If z is not specified, it defaults to fill if a channel, or stroke if a channel

children.name: fill
children.info: The fill color. If it is a channel it is bound to the color scale. Defaults to currentColor if the stroke is none, and to none otherwise.

children.name: fillOpacity
children.info: The fill opacity (a number between 0 and 1). If it is a channel it is bound to the opacity scale

children.name: stroke
children.info: The stroke color. If it is a channel it is bound to the color scale. Default is none

children.name: strokeOpacity
children.info: The stroke opacity (a number between 0 and 1). If it is a channel it is bound to the opacity scale

children.name: title
children.info: The tooltip as a string of text, possibly with newlines

children.name: curve
'basis'
children.info: A cubic basis spline (repeating the end points)

children.name: 'basis-open'
children.info: An open cubic basis spline

children.name: 'basis-closed'
children.info: A closed cubic basis spline

children.name: 'bump-x'
children.info: A Bézier curve with horizontal tangents

children.name: 'bump-y'
children.info: A Bézier curve with vertical tangents

children.name: 'cardinal'
children.info: A cubic cardinal spline (with one-sided differences at the ends)

children.name: 'cardinal-open'
children.info: An open cubic cardinal spline

children.name: 'cardinal-closed'
children.info: An closed cubic cardinal spline

children.name: 'catmull-rom'
children.info: A cubic Catmull–Rom spline (with one-sided differences at the ends)

children.name: 'catmull-rom-open'
children.info: An open cubic Catmull–Rom spline

children.name: 'catmull-rom-closed'
children.info: A closed cubic Catmull–Rom spline

children.name: 'linear'
children.info: A piecewise linear curve (i.e., straight line segments)

children.name: 'linear-closed'
children.info: A closed piecewise linear curve (i.e., straight line segments)

children.name: 'monotone-x'
children.info: A cubic spline that preserves monotonicity in x

children.name: 'monotone-y'
children.info: A cubic spline that preserves monotonicity in y

children.name: 'natural'
children.info: A natural cubic spline

children.name: 'step'
children.info: A piecewise constant function where y changes at the midpoint of x

children.name: 'step-after'
children.info: A piecewise constant function where y changes after x

children.name: 'step-before'
children.info: A piecewise constant function where x changes after y
The curve method, either a string or a function

children.name: tension
children.info: The curve tension for fine-tuning. The tension option only has an effect on cardinal and Catmull–Rom splines (cardinal, cardinal-open, cardinal-closed, catmull-rom, catmull-rom-open, and catmull-rom-closed). For cardinal splines, it corresponds to tension; for Catmull–Rom splines, alpha

children.name: strokeWidth
children.info: The stroke width in pixels

children.name: strokeLinejoin
children.info: The shape to be used at the corners of paths when they are stroked

children.name: strokeLinecap
children.info: The shape to be used at the end of open subpaths when they are stroked

children.name: strokeMiterlimit
children.info: A limit on the ratio of the miter length to the stroke-width used to draw a miter join. When the limit is exceeded, the join is converted from a miter to a bevel

children.name: strokeDasharray
children.info: The pattern of dashes and gaps used to paint the outline of the shape

children.name: mixBlendMode
children.info: This sets how an element's content should blend with the content of the element's parent and the element's background
Draws regions formed by a baseline (x1, y1) and a topline (x2, y2) as in an area chart. Often the baseline represents y = 0. While not required, typically the x and y scales are both quantitative

children.name: .barX()
filter
children.info: Filters the data according to the specified accessor or values. It does not affect inferred scale domains

children.name: sort
children.info: Sorts the data according to the specified comparator, accessor, or values. If the sort option is a function but does not take exactly one argument, it is assumed to be a comparator function. Otherwise, the sort option is interpreted as a channel value definition and thus may be either as a column name, accessor function, or array of values

children.name: reverse
children.info: Reverses the sorted (or if not sorted, the input) data order

children.name: x
children.info: If neither the x1 nor x2 option are specified, the x option may be specified as shorthand to apply an implicit stackX transform. This is the typical configuration for a horizontal bar chart with bars aligned at x = 0. If the x option is not specified, it defaults to the identity function

children.name: x1
children.info: The starting horizontal position bound to the x scale

children.name: x2
children.info: The ending horizontal position; bound to the x scale

children.name: y
children.info: The vertical position bound to the y scale, which must be band. If the y channel is not specified, the bar will span the full vertical extent of the plot (or facet)

children.name: fill
children.info: The fill color. If it is a channel it is bound to the color scale. Defaults to currentColor if the stroke is none, and to none otherwise.

children.name: fillOpacity
children.info: The fill opacity (a number between 0 and 1). If it is a channel it is bound to the opacity scale

children.name: stroke
children.info: The stroke color. If it is a channel it is bound to the color scale. Default is none

children.name: strokeOpacity
children.info: The stroke opacity (a number between 0 and 1). If it is a channel it is bound to the opacity scale

children.name: title
children.info: The tooltip as a string of text, possibly with newlines

children.name: insetTop
children.info: Adds spacing in pixels at the top for each element. Default is 0. Shorthand: inset

children.name: insetRight
children.info: Adds spacing in pixels on the right for each element. Default is 0..Shorthand: inset

children.name: insetBottom
children.info: Adds spacing in pixels at the bottom for each element. Default is 0. Shorthand: inset

children.name: insetLeft
children.info: Adds spacing in pixels on the left for each element. Default is 0. Shorthand: inset

children.name: inset
children.info: Adds spacing in pixels on the left, right, top and bottom. Default is 0. Shorthand for insetLeft, insetRight, insetTop, insetBottom

children.name: rx
children.info: The x-radius for rounded corners specified in either pixels or percentages (strings). Default is 0

children.name: ry
children.info: The y-radius for rounded corners specified in either pixels or percentages (strings). Default is 0

children.name: strokeWidth
children.info: The stroke width in pixels

children.name: strokeLinejoin
children.info: The shape to be used at the corners of paths when they are stroked

children.name: strokeLinecap
children.info: The shape to be used at the end of open subpaths when they are stroked

children.name: strokeMiterlimit

children.name: strokeDasharray
children.info: The pattern of dashes and gaps used to paint the outline of the shape

children.name: mixBlendMode
children.info: This sets how an element's content should blend with the content of the element's parent and the element's background

Draws rectangles where y is ordinal and x is quantitative. There is usually one ordinal value associated with each bar, such as a name, and two quantitative values defining a lower and upper bound. The lower bound is often not specified explicitly because it defaults to zero as in a conventional bar chart

children.name: insetRight
children.info: Adds spacing in pixels on the right for each element. Default is 0..Shorthand: inset

children.name: insetBottom
children.info: Adds spacing in pixels at the bottom for each element. Default is 0. Shorthand: inset

children.name: insetLeft

children.name: ry

children.name: strokeLinejoin
children.info: The shape to be used at the corners of paths when they are stroked

children.name: strokeLinecap
children.info: The shape to be used at the end of open subpaths when they are stroked

children.name: strokeMiterlimit
children.info: A limit on the ratio of the miter length to the stroke-width used to draw a miter join. When the limit is exceeded, the join is converted from a miter to a bevel

children.name: strokeDasharray
children.info: The pattern of dashes and gaps used to paint the outline of the shape

children.name: mixBlendMode
children.info: This sets how an element's content should blend with the content of the element's parent and the element's background

children.info: The horizontal position bound to the x scale which must be band. If the x channel is not specified, the tick will span the full horizontal extent of the plot (or facet)

children.name: y
children.info: The vertical position bound to the y scale

children.name: fill
children.info: The fill color. If it is a channel it is bound to the color scale. Defaults to none

children.name: fillOpacity
children.info: The fill opacity (a number between 0 and 1). If it is a channel it is bound to the opacity scale

children.name: stroke
children.info: The stroke color. If it is a channel it is bound to the color scale. Default is currentColor

children.name: inset
children.info: Adds spacing in pixels on the left, right, top and bottom. Default is 0. Shorthand for insetLeft, insetRight, insetTop, insetBottom

children.name: strokeWidth

children.name: strokeLinejoin

children.name: strokeLinecap

children.name: strokeMiterlimit
children.info: A limit on the ratio of the miter length to the stroke-width used to draw a miter join. When the limit is exceeded, the join is converted from a miter to a bevel

children.name: strokeDasharray

children.info: Filters the data according to the specified accessor or values. It does not affect inferred scale domains

children.name: sort
children.info: Sorts the data according to the specified comparator, accessor, or values. If the sort option is a function but does not take exactly one argument, it is assumed to be a comparator function. Otherwise, the sort option is interpreted as a channel value definition and thus may be either as a column name, accessor function, or array of values

children.name: .formatIsoDate()
children.info: This function takes one argument (date) and returns the shortest equivalent ISO 8601 UTC string

children.name: .formatWeekday()
children.info: This function takes two arguments (locale, format) and returns a function that formats a given week day number (from 0 = Sunday to 6 = Saturday) according to the specified locale and format. The locale is a BCP 47 language tag and defaults to U.S. English. The format is a weekday format: either narrow, short, or long; if not specified, it defaults to short

children.name: .formatMonth()
children.info: This function takes two arguments (locale, format) and returns a function that formats a given month number (from 0 = January to 11 = December) according to the specified locale and format. The locale is a BCP 47 language tag and defaults to U.S. English. The format is a month format: either 2-digit, numeric, narrow, short, long; if not specified, it defaults to short
